sub_title: Freelance Consultant at HortiFor Advisory Services
summary:
Who I am 
•	I am a specialist in tropical (agro) forestry, tree nurseries (management) and organic foodcrops.
•	I am a project coordinator - coach, researcher and consultant in tropical forestry, tree species selection, tree nurseries and foodcrops with more than 40 years working experiences in the Netherlands and in the tropics.

Working experiences
•	16 years as project leader and researcher in West Africa (Benin, Burkina Faso, Ghana) and South East Asia (Indonesia) for different organizations and a private company. 
•	In the Netherlands I combined national forestry research with consultancies and research in Gabon, Indonesia, Malaysia, Burkina Faso, Mali, Niger, Honduras, Vietnam and Mozambique.
•	I also have 10 years of working experiences as senior assistant researcher in tree breeding, selection and vegetative propagation stationed in the Netherlands

Specialties:
•	Tropical forest restoration, reforestation of Imperata c. grasslands, Buffer zone development
• Tree plantations establishment, tree nurseries & seed orchards
•	Tree improvement & species selection (Netherlands, dry and wet tropics). 
•	Growing organic cocoa, organic ginger under agro-forestry systems and Moringa oliefera
•	Tropical food crops in Benin
•	Project management, training and extension

profile_positions.description:
•	Nov. 2018: Training “Organic farming management of vegetables” and PUM project manager. BacKan Vocational Training College, Vietnam. 
•	May 2018: Programming training the Agro-forestry teachers 2018 – 2020, BacKan Vocational Training College, Vietnam 
•	October 2017: Advisory mission on Macadamia tree crop management and on the management of other food crops (beans, dragon fruit, mango, Sterculia versicolor etc) of different farms near Myitkyina, North Myanmar
•	February 2017: Advisory mission on Macadamia tree crop management and on the management of other food crops  (beans, dragon fruit, mango, Sterculia versicolor etc) of different farms near Mandalay, Center of Myanmar
•	November 2016: Advisory mission on Macadamia crop management, irrigation and potential dam construction in Northern Malawi for a private company.
•	February-March 2016: Second Mission as consultant to the company MORYLAQ (DR Congo) in the cultivation, organization of Moringa oleifera, Aquilaria crassna and Aquilaria subintegra, Cananga odorata (Ylang-Ylang) and the reforestation of 1479 hectares.(Congo)
•	November/December 2015: Consultant to the company MORYLAQ (DR Congo) in the cultivation,  organization of Moringa oleifera, Aquilaria crassna and Aquilaria subintegra, Cananga odorata (Ylang-Ylang) and the reforestation of 1479 hectares (Congo)
•       April 2015, Adviser for a private company in the production of mango-, citrus- and banana-plants.  Recommendations had been presented in a technical manual (Sudan);
•	2013: Second mission as adviser in Organic ginger growing, establishment trials and farmers' plantations, extension and training (Vietnam);
•	In 2012: Adviser private company in Organic ginger growing, selection,  and export (Vietnam);
•	In 2011: Adviser growing, planning organic cocoa at farmer's level (Honduras).

profile_positions.title: Affiliated Expert - Freelance Consultant

profile_positions.description: The foundation Barbarugo aims at an effective way of foreign aid in Ghana. Millions of people live in poor circumstances and grinding poverty. The north part of Ghana is too dry en too infertile for successful farming and horticulture. Bamboo is one of the few plants that is able to grow in that area. However in many other parts of the country, where the climate circumstances are more favourable than in the north, a lot of land is not cultivated and offers people a better future with the cultivation of bamboo.
profile_positions.title: Board Member of Consultants
Freelance Consultant

profile_positions.description: Research in (tropical) Forestry, literature studies, part-time lecturer.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Ecology and (tropical) Forestry

profile_positions.description:
Project Leader  FORM Ghana Ltd. 
- Contributed under the responsibility of the Director to the establishment of the reforestation Enterprise, that plants degraded forest reserves with commercially valuable species.
- Main tasks: Nursery establishment for a production of 500.000 plants, day-to-day management, transfer knowledge and training.
- Contributed under the responsibility of the Director to a setup of the necessary infrastructure: a model nursery, training centre, housing, etc and pilot plantations, including plantations of various tree species  and intercropping the first two years by farmers. 
- Contributed to the certification of  FORM Ghana according to the FSC and carbon credit standards.  

In July 2009 - after 1.5 years - FORM Ghana Ltd established under the guidance of his Director, M. Vroom, 600 ha plantations (mainly Tectona grandis + local species) with more than 50 permanent employees and about150 casual workers.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader

profile_positions.description:
•	Technical and scientific support to forestry  research projects (Netherlands, Europe and the tropics). 
•	Project planning (Logical Framework Planning). 
•	Advising, planning for the reforestation of 300 ha in Indonesia. 
•	Stimulating output publications, 
•	Evaluation 12 year research results Tropenbos Kalimantan project. 
•	Presentations research on workshops and symposia.
•	Dipterocarp Nursery manual 
•	Provenances trials and nursery research 
•	Seed orchard establishment and training
•	Sahelian Fruit trees

Species involved:
•	Netherlands: Ulmus cv
•	Indonesia, Malaysia: 
Peronema canescens, Dipterocarpaceae sp., Aquilaria microcapa (Gaharu), Octomeles sumatrana, Anthocephalus chilensis, Dyera costulata, Terminalia sp., Acacia mangium, 
•	Gabon: 
Aucoumea klaineana Pierre (Okoumé)
•	Burkina Faso, Mali, Niger : 
Adansonia digitata (Baobab) , Parkia biglobosa (African Locust Bean) , Tamarindus indica (Tamarind), Zizyphus mauritiana (Jujuber)
profile_positions.title: Researcher Ecology and Tropical Forestry

company.name: Forever Green Kalimantan Ltd (PT Kalimantan Hijau Lestari)

profile_positions.company: Forever Green Kalimantan Ltd (PT Kalimantan Hijau Lestari)
profile_positions.description:
Initiator, Technical Director and share holder of the tree nursery company “Forever Green Kalimantan Ltd” (PT Kalimantan Hijau Lestari) in East Kalimantan, Indonesia. Production and sales of local trees species and fruit trees for the local forestry (concession holders) and farmers.

•	Produced forestry species such as:
Dipterocarpaceae sp., Peronema canescens, Aquilaria microcapa (Gaharu), Octomeles sumatrana, Eusideroxylon zwageri (Ulin)
•	Produced fruit tree species: Mangifera cv, Durio cv, Arthocarpus sp., Nephelium lappaceum L.(rambutan), Psidium guajava,
profile_positions.title: Technical Director and share holder

profile_positions.description:
Acting as the representative team project leader and as researcher forest restoration, tree nurseries and selection of local tree species for reforestation activities  at the Wanariset near Balikpapan (East Kalimantan, Indonesia)
•	Own research activities: 
Reforestation degraded soils (Imperata cylindrica grasslands); enrichment planting with indigenous tree species; selection local tree species (propagated in nursery and planted in plantations); vegetative and generative propagation; training; supervising in the field of (PhD) candidates; analysing and reporting: active participation in workshops and symposia.

Species involved in the research:
•	More than 20 dipterocarp species such as: Shorea spp, Dryobalanops spp., Anisoptera spp., Dipterocarpus spp. etc
•	More than 40 local pioneer species such as: Peronema canescens,  Calophyllum inophyllum, Anthocephalus chinensis, Macaranga spp., Kokoona sp., Schima wallichii, Neonauclea gigantea, Vernonia arborea etc
•	and exotic species: Acacia mangium, Eucalyptus deglupta, Gmelina arborea, Leuceana spp., etc
profile_positions.title: Researcher forestry and Representative project leader

volunteer_experiences.description:
The members (all volunteers) of the "Standard Fruit Trees Brigade - Winterswijk" are experienced pruning specialists and they often have themselves a fruit orchard (apples, pears, plums, cherries) in property. The members jointly prune tall fruit trees, which have been abandoned to their fate. Municipalities and orchard owners, who can no longer take care of the orchard maintenance itself, increasingly rely on the brigade. The brigade borrows a special tool trolley with selected tools from Landscape Foundation Gelderland (Stichting Landschapsbeheer Gelderland)
http://landschapsbeheergelderland.nl/alle-vrijwilligersgroepen-per-regio/hoogstambrigade-winterswijk/
The working days of pruning are mainly in the winter and on Saturday.
